quotes.quote: The innocent seldom find an uncomfortable pillow.
The innocence of childhood is like the innocence of a lot of animals.
Innocence is a kind of insanity.
The innocent and the guiltless may not ask the apologies since one has not, even the clue of it.
It's innocence when it charms us, ignorance when it doesn't.
The innocence of children is what makes them stand out as a shining example to the rest of mankind.
Innocence ain't all it's cracked up to be, you know. Innocent little kids rip the wings off flies, because they don't know any better. That's innocence
Ignorance is not innocence but sin.
Innocence always calls mutely for protection when we would be so much wiser to guard ourselves against it: innocence is like a dumb leper who has lost his bell, wandering the world, meaning no harm.
Silence in the face of evil is itself evil: God will not hold us guiltless. Not to speak is to speak. Not to act is to act.
Innocence most often is a good fortune and not a virtue.
It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
Innocence, once lost, can never be regained; Darkness, once gazed upon, can never be lost.
Innocence is like polished armor; it adorns and defends.
Everyone is innocent unless proven otherwise.
The essential self is innocent, and when it tastes its own innocence knows that it lives for ever.
There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.
Innocence tinctures all things with brightest hues.
The artificial is always innocent.
Innocence is always unsuspicious.
Innocence is a language only mother nature teaches.
Innocence is its own defense.
One person's trauma is another's loss of innocence.
We each begin in innocence. We all become guilty.
The innocent is the person who explains nothing.
Be happy for no reason, like a child. If you are happy for a reason, you're in trouble, because that reason can be taken from you.
The innocent and the beautiful have no enemy but time.
A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act.
Innocent people have been drawn into someone else's conflict.
Always the innocent are the first victims, so it has been for ages past, so it is now.
There's always a wild side to an innocent face.
Remaining childish is a tremendous state of innocence.
Behind innocence there gathers a clotted mass of superstition, of twisted and misdirected impulse; clandestine flirtation, fads, and ragtime fill the unventilated mind.
The trust of the innocent is the liar's most useful tool.
The truly innocent are those who not only are guiltless themselves, but who think others are.
